snippet: The top United Nations human rights official, Navi Pillay, is concerned that the Afghan president, Hamid Karzai, is stacking a human rights panel with political appointees.
abstract: Top United Nations human rights official Navi Pillay emerges from meeting with Afghan Pres Hamid Karzai without hoped-for assurances that he will reverse decision to pack Afghanistan's human rights commission with political appointees; Pillay remains generally concerned about progress on human rights in country.
lead_paragraph: The top United Nations human rights official, Navi Pillay, is concerned that the Afghan president, Hamid Karzai, is stacking a human rights panel with political appointees.

headline.main: U.N. Official Presses Karzai on Rights Panel Appointees
headline.print_headline: Afghanistan: U.N. Official Says Progress on Human Rights Is ‘Fragile’

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject
